Title: Data Analyst
Description:
HCLTech is a global technology company, home to more than 220,000 people across 60 countries, delivering industry-leading capabilities centered around digital, engineering, cloud and AI, powered by a broad portfolio of technology services and products. We work with clients across all major verticals, providing industry solutions for Financial Services, Manufacturing, Life Sciences and Healthcare, Technology and Services, Telecom and Media, Retail and CPG, and Public Services. Consolidated revenues as of 12 months ending December 2024 totaled $13.8 billion.




A Data Analyst gathers, cleans, analyzes, and interprets data to provide actionable insights that support business decisions. They use various tools and techniques to identify trends, build reports, and collaborate with teams to improve business performance. Data Analysts are essentially problem solvers who help businesses understand their data and make informed decisions with Banking, Payments, KYC experience.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Collection and Management:
Data Analysis and Interpretation:
Reporting and Visualization:
Problem Solving:
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in SQL and Excel, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI not mandatory) . Knowledge of programming languages like Python or R can also be beneficial.
Analytical Skills:
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills are essential for identifying trends, patterns, and insights within data.
A good understanding of business principles around AFC / any other financial services domain and processes is helpful for identifying relevant data and interpreting results.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Amsterdam | 40 hours




Urban Gym Group is an industry pioneer within the European wellness and fitness community, with over 40 clubs and studios in major cities across the Netherlands and The United Kingdom. You might know us from brands such as Trainmore, ClubSportive, Renessence, BTY CLB, TRIB3, PILAT3S and Gymbox. Our ambitious domestic and international growth plans require an expansion of our Business Intelligence team.




We are looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will play a key part in driving our data-driven decision-making, making a significant impact on our continued success. Working closely with our Finance, Marketing, and Analytics teams, you will extract valuable insights from our data, helping us optimise operations, enhance member experiences, and support our ambitious growth plans.




Key responsibilities:

Conduct market research and analyses to identify new club locations.
Develop business cases for club expansion, including new builds, mergers, and acquisitions.
Build ETL processes to structure data from various sources for business use.
Create data views, tables, and reports supporting daily operations and strategic goals.
Design dashboards that enable informed, data-driven decisions.
Analyze growth to identify high-performing areas and new opportunities.
Query databases for insights on key metrics like revenue and member retention.
Use data to boost member retention, inform marketing strategies, and support revenue growth.




You:

2 to 4 years of experience in a data-focused role (e.g., Data Analyst, Data Engineer, or BI Specialist).
Proven expertise in data pipeline creation, data visualization, and analytics.
Advanced proficiency in SQL with a strong understanding of Azure SQL.
Hands-on experience building ETL pipelines, ideally using Python or Azure Synapse Analytics.
Proficient in Power BI, with a track record of designing impactful dashboards and reports.
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
Industry experience in fitness/wellness or retail is preferred, with insights into customer retention, revenue optimization, and business expansion.
Experience in consulting or retail is an asset, especially in roles focused on addressing business challenges.
Able to communicate complex data insights in a clear, actionable format for non-technical audiences.
You are based in or around Amsterdam




We offer:

A competitive salary plus 8% holiday pay
Hybrid way of working
26 holidays per year (based on full-time employment) and the option to exchange public holidays
Unlimited access to all our high-end fitness locations for you and a +1
Unlimited access to well-being services for you and your family via OpenUp
An inspiring head office, a short 10-minute walk from Amsterdam Central Station
A diverse and energetic team of 500 colleagues pushing boundaries and supporting one another

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity. 



With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.





Job Description



Want to use data intelligently to deliver maximum value to clients? It's a challenge that suits you perfectly and energizes you. You're looking for challenges where you can not only advise but also deliver tangible results. You want to make a difference. Are you ready for the next phase? Ready to tackle and solve complex data challenges and further specialize in your data management field? Then we'd love to get to know you.



What you'll be doing at the client's site



As a Data Analyst, you'll play a key role with our clients. You'll advise on their data management, develop data strategies, and translate these into workable solutions to maximize the value of their data. You'll be involved in all phases of the project, from developing data governance frameworks to implementing data quality processes and advising on data analysis. Interested in a project like this?



Moreover:



You'll identify improvement opportunities through thorough analyses of data sources and processes.
You'll design and implement data architecture and models for improved interoperability and scalability.
You'll ensure more efficient and effective systems; you'll advise and support data integration, migration, and transformation projects.
You'll provide insights that support your clients in making the right business decisions.
You'll provide training and support to users to help them manage and use data effectively.


Qualifications



This is you



You're naturally curious, enjoy a bit of fun, but are also deadly serious when it comes to the content. Sound familiar? Great, that's what we appreciate in a colleague. Furthermore, in this role, we'd like you to:



Enjoy your work!
Enjoy collaborating with colleagues and clients on interesting issues. In fact, that's a key part of your job.
You want to develop yourself every day with your positive attitude and drive.
You have strong communication skills and, above all, understand the importance of listening. To the client, colleagues, and of course, yourself!
You don't do the same thing every day; you prefer diverse and complex projects.
You do what you promise. You're accurate and ensure your work is completed on time, without compromising on quality.
You're a true team player. As a Precedencial, you can always count on support from your colleagues. Achievements are the result of successful collaboration, and we celebrate them together! We value this culture highly. What you bring

What you bring



Completed HBO (higher professional education) or WO (university education) degree
You speak fluent Dutch and English
At least one year of knowledge and experience with (meta)data management and data quality solutions
You possess relevant data and technical skills, such as data cleaning, data visualization, machine learning, knowledge of big data tools, and data warehousing. Knowledge of programming languages ​is a plus!Y
ou have a strong vision for data management within organizations.W

hat do we offer?C



ompetitive salary with extra advantages: a company car or flexible mobility plan, a clear and structured yearly salary increase and bonusesT
raining plan to develop yourself as an expert in your disciplineY
ou have the opportunity to work from home, the client or from our offices in Amsterdam or MaastrichtW
orking in an international environment which creates opportunities to share knowledge and work together on international projects with colleagues all over the worldA


dditional InformationU



nfortunately, we are unable to provide a work permit for this position. S



ia is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or disciplinary actions, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, and business needs. S

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Cloud & BI Solutions)




Do you enjoy turning business challenges into data-driven insights? Are you comfortable working with stakeholders, analyzing datasets, and guiding others in their growth? We’re looking for a Data Analyst to strengthen our team and help shape impactful, cloud-based data solutions.




What you’ll be doing:

Work closely with business stakeholders to understand processes and translate their needs into clear data requirements.
Frame business questions into testable hypotheses that lead to real insights.
Prepare and analyze datasets, collaborating with data engineers and modelers to create scalable solutions.
Apply data modeling approaches (both dimensional and relational) to support reporting and analytics.
Design compelling data visualizations and dashboards using tools such as Power BI.
Contribute to the development of new data propositions and analytical frameworks.




What you bring:

A completed WO or HBO degree (technical background preferred) with academic-level thinking and problem-solving ability.
At least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a consultancy role involving data-driven projects.
Experience working with SQL (Python and/or R is a plus).
Familiarity with business intelligence and reporting tools.
Experience with project methodologies such as Agile, Scrum, or DevOps is an advantage.
Fluency in Dutch and English.

Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Nederlands is vereist)

Amsterdam, Nederland

Tot €45.000 + benefits




Wil jij onderdeel worden van een divers data team dat zich onderscheid op de retail markt doormiddel van een eigen platform? Word de nieuwe data / business analist en sluit je aan bij een snelgroeiend retail – technologie bedijf.




Het bedrijf

Het bedrijf werkt met uiteenlopende retail relaties en voorziet retailers van klantinzichten en oplossingen doormiddel van data. Een snelgroeiend bedrijf met een multidisciplinair team om hard mee aan de slag te gaan aan het platform.




De Rol:

Als Data Analist ga je binnen het bedrijf aan de slag met data inrichting en beheer van een retail-analytics platform, waarbij je een cruciale rol kunt spelen bij business bevorderingen van de klant. Wat meer informatie wat betreft de rol:




Het aanleveren van analyses en inzichten intern en voor de klant
Support bij ad hoc analytische klant aanvragen
Inrichten en beheer van data en data – bronnen
Het opzetten van pipelines, en een bijdrage leveren aan het inrichten van dashboards en data solutions.
Bewaken van data kwaliteit.
Communiceren met retail-klanten ter bevordering van de business.




Expertise

Ervaring met Python, R, SQL, en meer
Uitstekende communicatie vaardigheden
Een innovatieve mindset die bijdragen aan verdere ontwikkelingen binnen het bedrijf
retail ervaring is een plus




The Benefits

Een passend salaris bij ervaring en achtergrond
30 vakantie dagen
Laptop / telefoon vergoeding
Een pensioen regeling




Interesse? Reageer doormiddel van het sturen van je CV via de knop naar Elisabeth Oudman.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analytics – Analyst – Rotterdam – ALTEN Nederland




De functie




Als onderdeel van ons groeiend bedrijf zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Analytics – Analyst om ons team te versterken en bij te dragen aan lopende klantprojecten in Rotterdam.




Als Data Analytics – Analyst omvatten je belangrijkste taken:




Data Analytics & Modeling: Ontwikkelen en optimaliseren van datamodellen met behulp van dimensionale modelleringstechnieken ter ondersteuning van analytische besluitvorming
Data Pipeline Ontwikkeling & Automatisering: Ondersteunen bij het ontwerp, de implementatie en automatisering van datastromen voor efficiënte gegevensextractie, transformatie en laden (ETL/ELT-processen)
Dashboard Ontwikkeling: Ontwerpen en bouwen van interactieve dashboards en datavisualisaties met behulp van business intelligence-tools
Samenwerking & Klantbetrokkenheid: Actief samenwerken met stakeholders om bedrijfsbehoeften te vertalen naar technische analysemogelijkheden
Ondersteuning van Digitale Transformatie: Identificeren en implementeren van datagestuurde oplossingen ter verbetering van bedrijfsprocessen
Projectbetrokkenheid: Ondersteunen van de volledige implementatiecyclus, inclusief requirement gathering, testen en uitrol




Jouw profiel




Bachelor- of masterdiploma in een relevante richting
3–5 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke functie
Vaardig in SQL, dimensionale modellering en data pipeline ontwikkeling
Ervaring met tools zoals Tableau, Power BI of SAP Analytics Cloud
Vloeiend in Nederlands en Engels
Gewenste soft skills: communicatievaardig, analytisch, proactief, leergericht




Arbeidsvoorwaarden

Je krijgt een vast contract
Je krijgt een leaseauto met tankpas
Mogelijkheid tot hybride werken
Maandelijkse netto onkostenvergoeding
27 vakantiedagen met de mogelijkheid om 10 extra dagen bij te kopen
Pensioenregeling zonder eigen bijdrage




Waarom kiezen voor ALTEN?




Impactvolle projecten in belangrijke sectoren: Draag bij aan betekenisvolle initiatieven in sectoren zoals defensie, transport, telecom en financiën, waar jouw expertise echt het verschil maakt.
Een breed klantenportfolio: Werk samen met zowel grote marktleiders als innovatieve middelgrote bedrijven en verzamel zo diverse en verrijkende ervaringen.
Versterk je loopbaan dankzij SDG’s expertise: Profiteer van voortdurende leermogelijkheden, technische communities en kennisdeling, versterkt door de integratie van SDG binnen ALTEN.
Een cultuur van innovatie en samenwerking: Ontplooi je in een omgeving die creativiteit waardeert, kennisdeling aanmoedigt en gezamenlijk succes stimuleert.




Over ALTEN




ALTEN is een wereldwijde leider in engineering- en technologieconsultancy, en ondersteunt topklanten in hun innovatie- en R&D-strategieën. Met meer dan 57.000 medewerkers in meer dan 30 landen zijn we actief in sectoren zoals lucht- en ruimtevaart, automotive, telecom, financiën, energie en life sciences.




ALTEN Netherlands is een belangrijke entiteit binnen de ALTEN Group, met kantoren in Eindhoven, Capelle aan den IJssel, Apeldoorn, Groningen en Amstelveen. Onze 550+ consultants leveren hoogwaardige oplossingen in technologie en IT. Al meer dan 20 jaar dragen we in Nederland bij aan impactvolle projecten in hightech, defensie, transport, telecom en financiën, en ondersteunen we bedrijven in hun technologische transformatie.




Een belangrijke stap in onze ontwikkeling was de overname van SDG, erkend als pionier in Data, Analytics & AI-consultancy en expert in complexe systeemengineering. Deze strategische stap heeft onze technische expertise vergroot en ons aanbod van geavanceerde oplossingen verbreed. Door de integratie van SDG’s kennis kunnen we innovatieve oplossingen bieden die extra waarde creëren voor zowel onze klanten als consultants, in Nederland en daarbuiten.




Klaar voor jouw volgende uitdaging?

Solliciteer nu en neem deel aan boeiende en impactvolle projecten bij ALTEN Nederland!

Show more
HTML:
Data Analytics – Analyst – Rotterdam – ALTEN Nederland


De functie


Als onderdeel van ons groeiend bedrijf zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Analytics – Analyst om ons team te versterken en bij te dragen aan lopende klantprojecten in Rotterdam.


Als Data Analytics – Analyst omvatten je belangrijkste taken:


  • Data Analytics & Modeling: Ontwikkelen en optimaliseren van datamodellen met behulp van dimensionale modelleringstechnieken ter ondersteuning van analytische besluitvorming
  • Data Pipeline Ontwikkeling & Automatisering: Ondersteunen bij het ontwerp, de implementatie en automatisering van datastromen voor efficiënte gegevensextractie, transformatie en laden (ETL/ELT-processen)
  • Dashboard Ontwikkeling: Ontwerpen en bouwen van interactieve dashboards en datavisualisaties met behulp van business intelligence-tools

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

CCP Global, is the global association for Central Counterparties (CCPs), representing 43 members operating more than 60 CCPs globally across the Americas, EMEA, and the Asia-Pacific region. The organization promotes effective, practical, and appropriate risk management and operational standards to ensure the safety and efficiency of the financial markets it represents.




Role Description

This is a full-time role for a Data Analyst located on-site in the Amsterdam Area. The Data Analyst will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to provide insights and support decision-making processes. Daily tasks include performing data modeling, conducting statistical analyses, and preparing detailed reports. Additional responsibilities include communicating findings to stakeholders and collaborating with other departments to support organizational goals.




Qualifications

Strong Analytical Skills and Data Analytics experience
Proficiency in Statistics and Data Modeling techniques
Excellent Communication skills for presenting analytical insights
Attention to detail and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Experience in the financial industry is a plus
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Science, Statistics, Economics, or related field
Show more

  • Excellent Communication skills for presenting analytical insights

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

At TOPdesk, we simplify IT service management, so teams can focus on work that truly matters. With over 900 employees across 11 offices and 10 million users worldwide, we’re committed to delivering reliable IT solutions with a human touch. Our platform empowers organizations with easy setup, customizable templates, and world-class support.

Job Description

Role Summary

As a Data Analyst, you’ll play a key role in enabling data-driven decision-making across TOPdesk by delivering trusted insights stakeholders can rely on and ensuring data quality. You will analyze complex datasets, create impactful visualizations, and provide recommendations that influence key business decisions and long-term strategy. You’ll work closely with colleagues in IT and across the business to ensure stakeholders have access to accurate, accessible, and actionable data.

What You’ll Be Doing


Analyze, create and manage datasets, identifying trends, patterns, and opportunities
Build and maintain dashboards and reports that clearly visualize key metrics and performance indicators
Work closely with teams across Sales, Marketing, Finance, and other key departments to turn challenges into clear, data-backed solutions and foundational datasets
Collaborate with Data Engineering, Business Applications, and other IT teams to understand the data journey and ensure seamless, governed data flows from source to end-user
Carry out on-the-spot analyses to quickly solve important business questions
Ensure data quality through governance and validation practices, while maintaining awareness of relevant data privacy regulations
Identify and refine key performance metrics that drive strategic decisions
Explore and adopt new tools, methods, and trends in data analytics to continuously improve capabilities


Qualifications

What You Bring

Education & Experience


Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
Minimum 5 years of experience in data analysis, with demonstrated success in delivering insights that inform decisions


Technical Skills


Able to turn complex datasets into clear insights that drive confident business decisions
Proficiency in SQL and Python, or similar data analysis relevant languages
Experience with visualization tools such as Qlik, Tableau, Power BI, or similar
Knowledge of data governance, data privacy (such as GDPR), and practices for ensuring data quality


Soft Skills


Adaptable and solution-oriented, with strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Skilled at building collaborative relationships and understanding business processes
Excellent communication and presentation skills to explain technical findings to non-technical audiences
Takes initiative to identify gaps, owns the process of fixing them, and thrives with minimal supervision
Proactive in learning new tools and staying current with analytics trends


Where will you end up?

As a Data analyst you will end up in team 'Orion' in the TOPdesk IT department! TOPdesk is an internationally growing software and consultancy company and the creator of the best service management tool in the Netherlands. With over 900 colleagues in 8 countries, we work together every day to make our customers’ services better, smarter and more fun.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst / Data Visualization Expert
Description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they are doing!

We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.

Data Analyst / Data Visualization Expert

6 month FTC

Location: Eindhoven (onsite 3 days per week)

Fractal is a strategic AI partner to Fortune 500 companies with a vision to power every human decision in the enterprise. Fractal is building a world where individual choices, freedom, and diversity are the greatest assets. An ecosystem where human imagination is at the heart of every decision. Where no possibility is written off, only challenged to get better. We believe that a true Fractalite is the one who empowers imagination with intelligence. Fractal has been featured as a Great Place to Work by The Economic Times in partnership with the Great Place to Work® Institute and recognized as a ‘Cool Vendor’ and a ‘Vendor to Watch’ by Gartner.

About The Role

As a Data Analyst / Data Visualization Expert you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets and creating compelling visuals that communicate insights effectively to various stakeholders. Your role will involve both rigorous data analysis and the design of clear, precise, and engaging visualizations.

Key Responsibilities


Conduct thorough data analysis to identify trends, correlations, and patterns within datasets.
Develop impactful data visualizations using tools such as QuickSight, QlikSense, Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Create dashboards and reports that effectively communicate data findings to technical and non-technical audiences.
Ensure data integrity and quality by continuously auditing and cleansing data.
Work alongside cross-departmental teams to integrate data-driven insights into business strategies.
Provide technical guidance on best practices for data visualization and data storytelling.
Stay informed about the latest trends and techniques in data visualization and analytics.



Qualifications


Bachelor's/Master degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in data analysis and data visualization.
Proficient in using data visualization tools such as QuickSight, QlikSense,Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Strong analytical skills and experience with analytics tools such as SQL, Python, or R.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to convey complex data insights in a simple and impactful way.
Demonstrated ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team environment.
Strong attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy.
Experience with dashboard design and data storytelling.
Preferred: Java engineering experience for data processing and system integration tasks.



If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

Not the right fit? Let us know you're interested in a future opportunity by clicking Introduce Yourself in the top-right corner of the page or create an account to set up email alerts as new job postings become available that meet your interest!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst II - Pyspark
Description:
Data Analyst II

We are supporting a global organisation.

Contract Duration:  6 months initially – 40 hours per week – up to 105 EUR per hour, 40 hours per week, 3 days per week in the AMS office

Hiring Manager’s Focus:
Must haves: We looking for a seasoned person with solid background in building scallable reporting solutions and working with senior stakeholders. Strong PySpark and SQL background is a must, as well as solid soft skills in data storytelling / building self serving tools.
- 40 hours per week
- Hybrid. 3 days in the office
- Duration 6 months no extension
- Reason req: Sick Leave, plus workload
- Commercial / Direct projects support and automating of leadership reporting
- 2 interviews FIT and Tech (business case)


We are seeking a Data Analyst II to play a key role in driving analytics initiatives, reporting, visualization, and analysis within a dynamic business area. This role combines strong business understanding with technical expertise in data analytics to deliver impactful, scalable, and long-term solutions that influence decision-making.

Key Responsibilities
Own the design and delivery of end-to-end Data Analytics solutions, from idea generation through to implementation.
Translate business challenges into data stories, working autonomously to prepare, analyse, and visualise data for stakeholder needs.
Deliver reporting, dashboards, and insights that inform strategic and operational business decisions.
Engage with and manage junior to mid-level stakeholders, clearly communicating complex findings and aligning solutions to business impact.
Leverage knowledge of data analysis, workflows, tools, and methods to drive efficiency and effectiveness in delivering insights.
Mentor and support junior colleagues, contributing to a culture of learning and excellence within the analytics team.
Actively participate in the wider data community, supporting initiatives that improve effectiveness and collaboration across teams.
Partner with related crafts (e.g. Data Engineering) to anticipate data needs and ensure smooth project delivery.
Ensure data quality and stability through adherence to best practices, peer reviews, and reproducible approaches.
Identify opportunities to apply new methods, tools, and approaches to enhance analysis and reporting capabilities.
About You
Strong background in data analytics and visualisation, with proven experience delivering actionable insights.
Skilled at stakeholder management, with the ability to work independently and prioritise based on business impact.
Comfortable translating complex data into intuitive, impactful, and scalable solutions.
Collaborative, proactive, and eager to share knowledge through mentoring and team support.
Curious, adaptable, and motivated to explore new approaches and continuously expand technical capabilities.
This is a great opportunity for someone who thrives at the intersection of business understanding and data expertise, and who wants to make a tangible impact by shaping decisions through analytics.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your Tasks

Role

At MediaMarkt, we believe in innovation, growth, and freedom. As a dynamic company, we want to offer our customers the best shopping experience by placing data at the center of our operations. If you are looking for a fast-changing environment where you can make immediate and big impact using business intelligence, reporting, statistical analysis and machine learning, then this job is for you! In our Data & Analytics team, we are looking for a Data Analyst. The role includes:


Create and maintain an information infrastructure to empower organizational teams with data-driven insights for optimizing processes and business decision-making.
Data Analysis and Modeling: Analyze large and complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Develop and implement predictive models and machine learning algorithms. Perform statistical analyses to support business decision-making.
Data Collection & Organization: Collaborate with internal teams and data engineers to identify relevant datasets, gather data from various sources (sales, inventory, customer feedback, market research, external providers), and develop & maintain a structured tables for easy access and analysis.
Data Visualization & Reporting: Create and maintain appealing reports and dashboards in Power BI to facilitate data-driven decision-making. Create compelling data visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders. Develop dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs). Present data insights in a clear and concise manner to non-technical audiences.
Data Products / Solutions: Develop scalable data products to address business challenges, achieve process optimization or improve decision making. Build and implement tools to enable business lines to maximize the value of insights and reports.
Requirements Gathering: Partner with organizational teams to understand their business needs and translate them into actionable data product/reporting proposals that scale across business lines and improve decision-making processes.
Collaboration and Support: Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their data needs, provide actionable insights and support data-driven decision-making across the organization. Support data scientists and data engineers with data analysis, dashboarding and visualizations
Research and Development: Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data analytics, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. Experiment with new tools, techniques, and methodologies to improve data analysis processes. Contribute to the development of best practices and standards for data science within the organization.
Technical support: provide (limited) technical support with settings in RELEX, PriceFx and/or or category management related systems


Your Profile

Requirements

You are a builder. You love to set-up new ways of working, data pipeline & data projects and to embed those in the daily operations of the team. You get energy from seeing your colleagues use data products & you are an eager learner. You understand that the customer is at the heart of all our operations and you enjoy working closely with other departments to support our customers. For the practical requirements, we also expect:


Master’s degree in Economics, Econometrics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or other relevant areas
2-3 years work experience as data analyst
English (must have), Dutch (Pro)
Experience with Python/R and SQL a must
Experience with PowerBI / Looker
Experience with GCP / Google BigQuery (Pro)
Experience data projects and project management


About Us

For us"Let's Go!"is not just a slogan, it is an attitude. We love technology and we want to excite. We have fun and want to inspire. We are number one in Benelux and Europe. We influence how people experience and use technology. We make the difference and are there for our customers, through all channels. Together with our 50.000 employees across Europe, we create the shopping experience of the future.

Our best solutions arise when diverse perspectives come together. Diversity is key to achieving our vision of becoming the Experience Champion in Consumer Electronics. We value diversity, promote equal opportunities, and foster inclusion—join our team!

Additional Benefits

Job Infos

Location: Rotterdam

Media Markt Hoofdkantoor

Department: HQ - Group Indirect Procurement & Category Management

Entrylevel: Professional Level

Type of Employement: Full Time/Part Time

Working Hours: 40

Persona: Job Requisition HQ Employee

Recruiter: Stefan Romeijn

Recruiter: Karen van Vliet
Show more

In our Data & Analytics team, we are looking for a Data Analyst. The role includes:

  • Create and maintain an information infrastructure to empower organizational teams with data-driven insights for optimizing processes and business decision-making.
  • Data Analysis and Modeling: Analyze large and complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Develop and implement predictive models and machine learning algorithms. Perform statistical analyses to support business decision-making.
  • Data Collection & Organization: Collaborate with internal teams and data engineers to identify relevant datasets, gather data from various sources (sales, inventory, customer feedback, market research, external providers), and develop & maintain a structured tables for easy access and analysis.
  • Data Visualization & Reporting: Create and maintain appealing reports and dashboards in Power BI to facilitate data-driven decision-making. Create compelling data visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders. Develop dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs). Present data insights in a clear and concise manner to non-technical audiences.
  • Data Products / Solutions: Develop scalable data products to address business challenges, achieve process optimization or improve decision making. Build and implement tools to enable business lines to maximize the value of insights and reports.
  • Requirements Gathering: Partner with organizational teams to understand their business needs and translate them into actionable data product/reporting proposals that scale across business lines and improve decision-making processes.
  • Collaboration and Support: Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their data needs, provide actionable insights and support data-driven decision-making across the organization. Support data scientists and data engineers with data analysis, dashboarding and visualizations
  • Research and Development: Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data analytics, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. Experiment with new tools, techniques, and methodologies to improve data analysis processes. Contribute to the development of best practices and standards for data science within the organization.
  • Technical support: provide (limited) technical support with settings in RELEX, PriceFx and/or or category management related systems

Your Profile

Requirements

You are a builder. You love to set-up new ways of working, data pipeline & data projects and to embed those in the daily operations of the team. You get energy from seeing your colleagues use data products & you are an eager learner. You understand that the customer is at the heart of all our operations and you enjoy working closely with other departments to support our customers. For the practical requirements, we also expect:

  • Master’s degree in Economics, Econometrics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or other relevant areas
  • 2-3 years work experience as data analyst
  • English (must have), Dutch (Pro)
  • Experience with Python/R and SQL a must
  • Experience with PowerBI / Looker
  • Experience with GCP / Google BigQuery (Pro)
  • Experience data projects and project management

About Us

For us"Let's Go!"is not just a slogan, it is an attitude. We love technology and we want to excite. We have fun and want to inspire. We are number one in Benelux and Europe. We influence how people experience and use technology. We make the difference and are there for our customers, through all channels. Together with our 50.000 employees across Europe, we create the shopping experience of the future.

Our best solutions arise when diverse perspectives come together. Diversity is key to achieving our vision of becoming the Experience Champion in Consumer Electronics. We value diversity, promote equal opportunities, and foster inclusion—join our team!

Additional Benefits

Job Infos

Location: Rotterdam

Media Markt Hoofdkantoor

Department: HQ - Group Indirect Procurement & Category Management

Entrylevel: Professional Level

Type of Employement: Full Time/Part Time

Working Hours: 40

Persona: Job Requisition HQ Employee

Recruiter: Stefan Romeijn

Recruiter: Karen van Vliet

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Nederlandstalig)

Amsterdam, Nederland

Tot €40.000 + benefits




Wil jij onderdeel worden van een divers data team dat zich onderscheid op de retail markt doormiddel van een eigen platform? Word de nieuwe data / business analist en sluit je aan bij een snelgroeiend retail – technologie bedijf.




Het bedrijf

Het bedrijf werkt met uiteenlopende retail relaties en voorziet retailers van klantinzichten en oplossingen doormiddel van data. Een snelgroeiend bedrijf met een multidisciplinair team om hard mee aan de slag te gaan aan het platform.




De Rol:

Als Data Analist ga je binnen het bedrijf aan de slag met data inrichting en beheer van een retail-analytics platform, waarbij je een cruciale rol kunt spelen bij business bevorderingen van de klant. Wat meer informatie wat betreft de rol:




Het aanleveren van analyses en inzichten intern en voor de klant
Support bij ad hoc analytische klant aanvragen
Inrichten en beheer van data en data – bronnen
Het opzetten van pipelines, en een bijdrage leveren aan het inrichten van dashboards en data solutions.
Bewaken van data kwaliteit.
Communiceren met retail-klanten ter bevordering van de business.




Expertise

Ervaring met Python, R, SQL, en meer
Uitstekende communicatie vaardigheden
Een innovatieve mindset die bijdragen aan verdere ontwikkelingen binnen het bedrijf
retail ervaring is een plus




The Benefits

Een passend salaris bij ervaring en achtergrond
30 vakantie dagen
Laptop / telefoon vergoeding
Een pensioen regeling




Interesse? Reageer doormiddel van het sturen van je CV via de knop naar Elisabeth Oudman.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analytics – Analyst – Groningen – ALTEN Nederland




De functie




Als onderdeel van ons groeiend bedrijf zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Analytics – Analyst om ons team te versterken en bij te dragen aan lopende klantprojecten in Groningen.




Als Data Analytics – Analyst omvatten je belangrijkste taken:




Data Analytics & Modeling: Ontwikkelen en optimaliseren van datamodellen met behulp van dimensionale modelleringstechnieken ter ondersteuning van analytische besluitvorming
Data Pipeline Ontwikkeling & Automatisering: Ondersteunen bij het ontwerp, de implementatie en automatisering van datastromen voor efficiënte gegevensextractie, transformatie en laden (ETL/ELT-processen)
Dashboard Ontwikkeling: Ontwerpen en bouwen van interactieve dashboards en datavisualisaties met behulp van business intelligence-tools
Samenwerking & Klantbetrokkenheid: Actief samenwerken met stakeholders om bedrijfsbehoeften te vertalen naar technische analysemogelijkheden
Ondersteuning van Digitale Transformatie: Identificeren en implementeren van datagestuurde oplossingen ter verbetering van bedrijfsprocessen
Projectbetrokkenheid: Ondersteunen van de volledige implementatiecyclus, inclusief requirement gathering, testen en uitrol




Jouw profiel




Bachelor- of masterdiploma in een relevante richting
3–5 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke functie
Vaardig in SQL, dimensionale modellering en data pipeline ontwikkeling
Ervaring met tools zoals Tableau, Power BI of SAP Analytics Cloud
Vloeiend in Nederlands en Engels
Gewenste soft skills: communicatievaardig, analytisch, proactief, leergericht




Arbeidsvoorwaarden

Je krijgt een vast contract
Je krijgt een leaseauto met tankpas
Mogelijkheid tot hybride werken
Maandelijkse netto onkostenvergoeding
27 vakantiedagen met de mogelijkheid om 10 extra dagen bij te kopen
Pensioenregeling zonder eigen bijdrage




Waarom kiezen voor ALTEN?




Impactvolle projecten in belangrijke sectoren: Draag bij aan betekenisvolle initiatieven in sectoren zoals defensie, transport, telecom en financiën, waar jouw expertise echt het verschil maakt.
Een breed klantenportfolio: Werk samen met zowel grote marktleiders als innovatieve middelgrote bedrijven en verzamel zo diverse en verrijkende ervaringen.
Versterk je loopbaan dankzij SDG’s expertise: Profiteer van voortdurende leermogelijkheden, technische communities en kennisdeling, versterkt door de integratie van SDG binnen ALTEN.
Een cultuur van innovatie en samenwerking: Ontplooi je in een omgeving die creativiteit waardeert, kennisdeling aanmoedigt en gezamenlijk succes stimuleert.




Over ALTEN




ALTEN is een wereldwijde leider in engineering- en technologieconsultancy, en ondersteunt topklanten in hun innovatie- en R&D-strategieën. Met meer dan 57.000 medewerkers in meer dan 30 landen zijn we actief in sectoren zoals lucht- en ruimtevaart, automotive, telecom, financiën, energie en life sciences.




ALTEN Netherlands is een belangrijke entiteit binnen de ALTEN Group, met kantoren in Eindhoven, Capelle aan den IJssel, Apeldoorn, Groningen en Amstelveen. Onze 550+ consultants leveren hoogwaardige oplossingen in technologie en IT. Al meer dan 20 jaar dragen we in Nederland bij aan impactvolle projecten in hightech, defensie, transport, telecom en financiën, en ondersteunen we bedrijven in hun technologische transformatie.




Een belangrijke stap in onze ontwikkeling was de overname van SDG, erkend als pionier in Data, Analytics & AI-consultancy en expert in complexe systeemengineering. Deze strategische stap heeft onze technische expertise vergroot en ons aanbod van geavanceerde oplossingen verbreed. Door de integratie van SDG’s kennis kunnen we innovatieve oplossingen bieden die extra waarde creëren voor zowel onze klanten als consultants, in Nederland en daarbuiten.




Klaar voor jouw volgende uitdaging?

Solliciteer nu en neem deel aan boeiende en impactvolle projecten bij ALTEN Nederland!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Be yourself at Protolabs

Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification.  We are an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to building a diverse team that feels they are valued in the workplace.  So do you feel you do not meet every single requirement but still intrigued? We encourage you to still apply!  You can help make our company even better.  We do not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, age, mental or physical ability, or any way you represent yourself.  We strongly believe diversity makes for more successful teams.

Why Protolabs?

We are the leaders in digital manufacturing. We hire doers, makers, and creative thinkers who tackle our roles with an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is centered around meaningful work that brings new and innovative products to market at unprecedented speeds. We are a diverse team that comes from all walks of life and take pride in our team who is smart, genuine, humble, and passionate about what we do. It’s our people who fuel our creativity and make our culture feel like home.

Join our team as a Data Analyst and Help drive decisions that matter!

This is a hybrid role based out of Amsterdam, Netherlands!

We’re looking for a curious, sharp, and proactive Data Analyst who speaks SQL as a native language, to join our growing team. In this role, you won’t just crunch numbers — you’ll partner closely with business stakeholders, uncover insights that shape strategy, enhancing data pipelines and help us make smarter, faster decisions across the company.

You’ll work alongside experienced analysts and report into a team that values clarity, creativity, and impact over dashboards-for-dashboard’s-sake. If you're excited about turning messy data into meaningful action, and you want to grow in a role where your work is seen, heard, and used — we’d love to hear from you.

Our Data / Analytics Tech Stack: Domo, SQL, DBT, Looker, Snowflake, Airbyte, Stitch, Python, Docker, MS SQL Servier, AWS: EC2, S3 etc.

What You'll Do


Work on a wide range of different Analytical projects across different teams in the company
Enhance data pipelines with DBT and accelerate our Analytics Engineering team with the data foundations and making them accessible in Domo / Looker with a semantic layer.
Pro-actively dig into the data, solving business challenges using insights from our quantitative data sources
Empower other teams and its analyst ambassadors with the necessary tools so they understand and analyze their core metrics
Prioritize various data requests and perform analyses on key issues to help various teams at Protolabs
Setup, maintain and improve the dashboards that are used throughout the organisation
Collaborating with different teams to ensure the quality and stability of the data used to feed core metrics
Be part and engage with a super fun International data / analytics team


What It Takes


2-5 years of experience in Data Analytics in a tech scale-up environment
Strong academic track record, preferably with a quantitative Masters degree
Skilled in at least SQL, Python is considered a plus
In depth experience with at least one BI Tool (Looker, Domo, Tableau, PowerBI, etc)
BONUS 1: Experience with CRM systems (Salesforce, Hubspot, Data Cloud etc.)
BONUS 2: Ambition / experience in advanced analytics to solve predictive modelling challenges


What's In It For You!


Part of our journey is clearly down to our amazing team, and we strongly believe in giving people a space to truly, authentically be themselves. We also believe that treating our employees well and sprinkling a great place to work with some nice perks can make work a little sweeter
Annual company bonus. We celebrate success together! Employees are not only rewarded for their achievements but also for contributing to the overall success of the business
Flexible and hybrid working arrangements! (we try to accommodate where it’s possible, so feel free to ask us more about this)
Wellness and well-being with access to OpenUp psychologists
Dog friendly office
Daily Lunch and snacks are provided in the office; it's a moment for our teams to connect and recharge. Shared meals strengthen our bonds and fuel collaboration.
We offer great opportunities for learning and development, including access to external educational events & trainings, access to our inhouse LEARN platform with diverse courses, training, and workshops, and various opportunities for you to develop your skills
Monthly €15 voucher through Alleo with discounts on fitness, food stores, electronics and more
Regular team events & socials
Show more

  • Dog friendly office
  • Daily Lunch and snacks are provided in the office; it's a moment for our teams to connect and recharge. Shared meals strengthen our bonds and fuel collaboration.
  • We offer great opportunities for learning and development, including access to external educational events & trainings, access to our inhouse LEARN platform with diverse courses, training, and workshops, and various opportunities for you to develop your skills
  • Monthly €15 voucher through Alleo with discounts on fitness, food stores, electronics and more
  • Regular team events & socials

Title: FP&A Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our FP&A team at Bizzdesign. Are you searching for a challenging new position within a dynamic international company? Then look no further because we might have a match!




Who are we?




Bizzdesign is a SaaS company with 25 years in the Enterprise Architecture and Strategic Portfolio Management industries, with our HQ in Enschede. Our platform helps large enterprises, including Fortune 500 companies, make better decisions through Enterprise Architecture. We recently acquired Alfabet and MEGA International, expanding our portfolio and enhancing our offerings. With over 600 people from 32 nationalities working across 19 countries, we are growing fast and making an impact.




At Bizzdesign, we pride ourselves on a culture of trust, flexibility, and no-nonsense collaboration. You will join a flat, transparent organization where autonomy is valued, and your voice matters; no layers of red tape, just smart people solving meaningful problems together. We believe in empowering our team with the freedom to work how and where they work best, supported by a strong foundation of mutual respect and accountability. If you are someone who thrives in a high-trust, low-ego environment and values results over hierarchy, you will fit right in.




What impact will you make?




As a Data Analyst in our FP&A team, you’ll be at the heart of transforming data into actionable insights that fuel smarter decisions across the business. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to translate their needs into impactful dashboards, models, and analyses that shape strategy and execution.




What will you do?




Acting as a trusted analytics partner to domain managers, providing data-driven insights and recommendations.
Building and maintaining scalable Power BI dashboards that are both insightful and future-proof.
Using Salesforce and other data sources to create meaningful reports and ensure consistent KPI definitions.
Designing and analyzing experiments with statistical models to validate ideas and guide decision-making.
Supporting the development of predictive analyses and contributing to strategies that identify growth opportunities and improve business performance.
Contributing to improving reporting tools and supporting data governance initiatives.




This role gives you the freedom to bring your expertise and ideas to life while making a visible impact on cross-departmental collaboration and decision-making.




Who are you?




You are a data storyteller with a strong technical foundation and a passion for turning numbers into business value. Curious, proactive, and collaborative, you thrive in a fast-paced, international environment and enjoy being a bridge between business and technology.




We are looking for someone with:




4+ years of experience in data analytics, ideally in a SaaS international setting.
Strong expertise in Power BI and Salesforce (must-have).
Advanced skills in SQL and Excel, with solid experience in BI tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, or similar).
A strong quantitative background (engineering, econometrics, sciences, or business analytics).
End-to-end understanding of databases, data warehouses, APIs, and data integration processes.
Ability to communicate complex insights in a clear and compelling way to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A self-starter mindset with eagerness to continuously improve processes and challenge the status quo.




What’s in it for you?




A competitive salary package, including an annual bonus
Premium pension plan to secure your future
28 vacation days with the option to buy 10 extras for ultimate flexibility
Hybrid working with 2 days a week in the office
An NS Business Card or mileage reimbursement to support your commute
Personal IT budget to upgrade your setup
Monthly work-from-home allowance to support your ideal home office setup
Supportive, collaborative team culture
Work with an international and diverse group of colleagues
Your input is valued, regardless of role or tenure

Recruitment process




In this role, you can expect the following interviewing process:

An initial screening call with our Internal Recruiter (30 minutes)
1st Interview with our FP&A and Business Applications managers (30 minutes)
Case-study development (2-3 hours)
Final Interview: CFO & peer combination (30 minutes)




Please submit your CV in English, as only this format will be reviewed.




Are you ready to start building your future with us?

Show more

Who are you?


You are a data storyteller with a strong technical foundation and a passion for turning numbers into business value. Curious, proactive, and collaborative, you thrive in a fast-paced, international environment and enjoy being a bridge between business and technology.


We are looking for someone with:


  • 4+ years of experience in data analytics, ideally in a SaaS international setting.
  • Strong expertise in Power BI and Salesforce (must-have).
  • Advanced skills in SQL and Excel, with solid experience in BI tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, or similar).
  • A strong quantitative background (engineering, econometrics, sciences, or business analytics).
  • End-to-end understanding of databases, data warehouses, APIs, and data integration processes.
  • Ability to communicate complex insights in a clear and compelling way to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • A self-starter mindset with eagerness to continuously improve processes and challenge the status quo.


What’s in it for you?


  • A competitive salary package, including an annual bonus
  • Premium pension plan to secure your future
  • 28 vacation days with the option to buy 10 extras for ultimate flexibility
  • Hybrid working with 2 days a week in the office
  • An NS Business Card or mileage reimbursement to support your commute
  • Personal IT budget to upgrade your setup
  • Monthly work-from-home allowance to support your ideal home office setup
  • Supportive, collaborative team culture
  • Work with an international and diverse group of colleagues
  • Your input is valued, regardless of role or tenure

Recruitment process


In this role, you can expect the following interviewing process:

  • An initial screening call with our Internal Recruiter (30 minutes)
  • 1st Interview with our FP&A and Business Applications managers (30 minutes)
  • Case-study development (2-3 hours)
  • Final Interview: CFO & peer combination (30 minutes)


Please submit your CV in English, as only this format will be reviewed.


Are you ready to start building your future with us?

Title: Data Science Intern (Analytics)
Description:
Interactive Entertainment Group (IEG) is responsible for the R&D, operation, and development of the company's interactive entertainment business including games and eSports. Through online gaming, live broadcasts, and offline eSports, IEG assists the company in leading the global interactive entertainment market to create better interactive entertainment content experiences for users.







Responsibilities:

• Analyze large-scale datasets to solve complex business and technical challenges in gaming through analytics, forecasting, machine learning, recommender systems, generative AI, experimentation, causal inference, and econometrics.

• Collaborate with product and engineering teams to develop data-driven strategies and implement solutions that enhance business value.

• Deliver actionable business insights to internal and external stakeholders.

• Stay updated with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning, and generative AI, utilizing these technologies to innovate in gaming applications.

• Engage in technical knowledge sharing, documentation, and cross-team collaboration.




Requirements:

• Pursuing a M.S., or Ph.D. degree in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Math, Economics, Computer Science, Machine Learning, etc.

• Experience in statistical analysis (probabilities, hypothesis testing, multivariate analysis, time series analysis, predictive modeling, A/B experiments, etc.).

• Experience with building complex data products and machine learning systems on large datasets preferred.

• Proficient in Python and SQL.

• Excellent communication, collaboration, execution capabilities, and keen business acumen.

• Passionate about games and the gaming industry.




Equal Employment Opportunity at Tencent

As an equal opportunity employer, we firmly believe that diverse voices fuel our innovation and allow us to better serve our users and the community. We foster an environment where every employee of Tencent feels supported and inspired to achieve individual and common goals.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're seeking a Data Analyst to join our team and elevate our analytics capabilities to new heights! If you're driven by uncovering meaningful patterns in data and love turning complex information into actionable business strategies, Nmbrs offers the perfect environment to make a real impact.

Your expertise in data analytics could be the key to unlocking our next breakthrough - are you ready to shape the future with us?




About Nmbrs:

We're a fast-growing scale-up building innovative HR & payroll technology. With 150+ colleagues in Amsterdam, Lisbon, and Stockholm, we do things differently. No traditional managers, a 4-day workweek, and the freedom to make an impact.




In this role, you'll:

Handle both backend data processing and frontend visualization to deliver comprehensive analytics platforms
Create regular reports and perform methodical analysis on product, financial, and performance data from discovery to delivery
Collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to define priorities, discuss data strategy, and communicate complex insights clearly
Oversee API management, Python ETL scripts, and end-to-end data workflows from extraction to analysis
Apply proven experience in analytics strategy, data analysis, and visualization to support decision-making across all company departments







A day at work

You start your day by checking in with your squad, sharing progress and discussing any challenges. As a team, you collaborate to remove blockers and support each other.

Later, you partner with a product specialist to investigate a feature that isn't performing as expected. You identify where the relevant data is stored and use SQL to extract the necessary information for analysis.

After validating the findings with stakeholders, you co-create a Power BI dashboard to visualize the insights. You then organize a meeting with the stakeholders who requested the data to walk them through the results and support data-driven decision-making.




Some ongoing projects in your future squad:

Churn analysis and root cause investigation
Automated data centralisation using Python/API containerised solutions
PowerBI dashboards for product insights, user behaviour and priority setting
Analysis to better understand the performance of Cross-sell products and new features Revenue forecasting and customer satisfaction reporting




What you'll bring:

Have a bachelor or masters degree in a technical field (HBO or WO level) (in Computer Science is a plus)
Have at least 2+ years of work experience as Data Analyst/Business Analyst in a Saas environment (mandatory)
Have proven experience with SQL and Python. PowerBI and Azure (or similar cloud service) knowledge is nice to have (must have)
Have experience with ETL pipelines and automation (must have)
Happy to communicate with your squad and other squads, able to make the translation from data to valuable business insights and able to present it to stakeholders
Are able to work independently and in a team, to be a real Difference-maker
Have a proactive, curious approach, since without managers this is essential
Speak English fluently (fluency in Dutch is a plus)




What's in it for you:

We offer a gross annual salary of 50K to 55K including holiday allowance, depending on experience;
Nmbrs is a flat organisation in which you have the freedom and responsibility to do what you are good at and have an impact, in an agile working environment;
A personal coach who helps you with your personal and professional growth as well as a yearly budget for training and personal development;
We ensure a healthy work-life balance;
For us full-time means a 4-day workweek giving you one paid personal day to spend in a way that will benefit you the most;
We have a big and light office space close to the Sloterdijk train station, and all the floors of the office are accessible by elevator;
We work hybrid at Nmbrs
We kick off the summer by bringing all offices together for an amazing event at a very secret location to spark togetherness and innovation and celebrate with each other;
Additionally we organise fun events of different themes every month, think: game nights, movie nights, ping pong tournaments, or pizza party (all events are voluntary);
Nmbrs offers the opportunity to go on an exchange to our offices in Lisbon or Stockholm for up to 4 months.




Please note: We are not able to consider candidates who are not living and working in the Netherlands. At this moment we are not providing relocation sponsorships.




As part of our hiring process, we conduct a criminal background check for all candidates reaching the final stages. This helps us ensure a safe and secure environment for everyone.




At Nmbrs, we celebrate diversity and promote an inclusive environment where our team members from all backgrounds, ages, genders, or sexual orientations feel equally appreciated. In order to achieve this, we are committed to shaping a hiring process that provides everyone with an equal opportunity to get hired.

In order to achieve this, we are committed to shaping a hiring process that provides everyone with an equal opportunity to get hired.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our dynamic, international team. The Data Analyst plays a key role in shaping the future of our innovative startup.

We're seeking a data-driven problem solver who is passionate about delivering the best possible monitoring solution for our customers. As a valued member of our growing company, you'll make sure the cutting-edge analytical solutions are leveraged for our customer. You’ll be working closely with operational teams to present your insights and with technology teams to drive innovation further.

Key activities:


Maintain and improve internal and external reporting procedures
Process and analyse data from IoT sensors
Create compelling data visualizations and reports
Communicate findings and observations effectively
Maintain customer facing dashboards
Realize the onboarding of new customers and monitoring on the dashboard



About Us

At Villari, we are dedicated to extending the lifetime of steel structures in ports, infrastructure, and the steel industry through our certified crack detection technology. Our permanently installed wireless sensors detect even the smallest fatigue cracks in critical locations of bridges and cranes by analysing variations in the magnetic field over time. Compared to traditional methods, we offer continuous and accurate inspection, carefree installation, competitive pricing, and certified technology. Our unique and patented solution has earned the trust of esteemed customers such as Tata Steel, Rijkswaterstaat, ProRail, ArcelorMittal, and many more. We take pride in our extensive coverage of 1700 sensors deployed across 11 countries, ensuring the safety and longevity of critical steel structures worldwide.

Villari’s core values are the following:


Integrity - We are honest about what we know and what we don't know for certain. We treat our data with the greatest care and understand that this is of utmost importance in this critical industrial environment in which we operate. There is always room to address doubts and uncertainties, such that nothing is swept under the rug.
Expertise - Our company is delivering seriously high-tech service: we’re not building a new app to order pizza. The combination of fatigue crack growth, ferromagnetic flux leakage, and seamless wireless communication is our unique domain in which we work with a proud team of highly-skilled and intellectual people. Customers rely on us because we know what we’re doing.
Accountability - We take responsibility for our actions. There’s no “not my problem” or “I don’t care” attitude at Villari. Learning from each other and carrying both a collective and individual feeling of ownership is extremely important in order to be an effective and well-balanced team.
Exploration - Villari was founded on the idea that we were bold enough to take complex physics and turn it into a meaningful product for our customers. As such we’ve pushed quite some boundaries along the way and we’re not afraid to turn left where others go right. On all levels people should be encouraged to try out new things and to test “wild ideas”. We understand and accept that new ideas sometimes turn out to be unsuccessful, as this is an integral part of exploring.
Approachability - As a company, and as individuals, we want to always be open for discussion, feedback, doubts, or just a casual chat about a topic unrelated to work. This goes towards clients, suppliers, colleagues, and towards superiors and people under your supervision. We help each other out and listen when others have something to say, regardless of seniority.



These values are at the core of our business and identity and it's very important that all our employees identify with these values.

What will you bring?


Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree (HBO level) in Data Science, Software Development, Physics, or a related technical field
Basic proficiency in Python, including experience with libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and Matplotlib
Solid understanding of data analysis methods
Strong communication skills; able to collaborate effectively across teams and departments
Proven track record of working in a highly structured and organised way. Be prepared to demonstrate this with examples from past work or internship experiences during the interview and case study
Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge of database management and SQL
Familiarity with IoT data analysis and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure)
Proficiency with Jupyter Notebooks or similar development environments
Nice to have:
Knowledge of electromagnetics (including principles of electromagnetic theory and applications)
Familiarity with Git version control and collaborative coding practices
Knowledge of IoT communication protocols / LoRaWAN
Skills & Attributes:
Excellent communication skills in English (written and verbal)
Ability to work both independently and as part of a collaborative team
Skilled in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)
Adaptability, proactivity, and a passion for learning in a fast-paced startup environment



What do we offer?


A gross salary between €2500,- and €3500,- per month, depending on your experience.
Contribute and experience being part of a scale-up with international ambitions.
Energetic and professional company culture, based on ownership and responsibility
25 vacation days per year
Hybrid and onsite working opportunities
Travel expenses covered
Every day we will provide a lunch at our office
Participate in the most fun company events and drinks
Show more

  • Familiarity with Git version control and collaborative coding practices
  • Knowledge of IoT communication protocols / LoRaWAN
  • Skills & Attributes:

  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a collaborative team
  • Skilled in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)
  • Adaptability, proactivity, and a passion for learning in a fast-paced startup environment


What do we offer?

  • A gross salary between €2500,- and €3500,- per month, depending on your experience.
  • Contribute and experience being part of a scale-up with international ambitions.
  • Energetic and professional company culture, based on ownership and responsibility
  • 25 vacation days per year
  • Hybrid and onsite working opportunities
  • Travel expenses covered
  • Every day we will provide a lunch at our office
  • Participate in the most fun company events and drinks

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Als Data Analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het inrichten, verzamelen, structureren en analyseren van data om inzichten te genereren voor interne en externe klanten. Je ondersteunt besluitvorming met heldere rapportages en visualisaties. Daarnaast richt je systemen in voor de onboarding van nieuwe projecten, zodat datastromen en informatiestromen vanaf de start goed zijn geborgd.

Wat ga je doen?



Je selecteert, analyseert en interpreteert data met behulp van modellen, software en statistische tools.
Je brengt informatiebehoeften in kaart en voert bronanalyses uit in overleg met stakeholders.
Je haalt data op uit databronnen via SQL of andere software en structureert deze in bruikbare formats.
Je bent betrokken bij ontwikkelingen en stemt deze af met o.a. data scientists en business vertegenwoordigers.
Je onderhoudt data in de systemen en databases en lost software- en/of data gerelateerde problemen op.
Je visualiseert data, ontwikkelt dashboards en stelt rapportages op.
Je richt systemen en processen in voor onboarding van nieuwe projecten.
Voor de uitvoering van je werkzaamheden maak je gebruik van SkySpark.



Jouw werkomgeving

Bij BAM Bouw en Techniek – Gebouwservices ligt de focus op het beheren en onderhouden van hoogwaardig vastgoed, met expertise in zowel bouwkundig als installatietechnisch onderhoud. Onze prioriteit is het aangaan van langdurige samenwerkingsverbanden met professionele klanten die streven naar integraal onderhoud en het behoud van de technische levensduur van gebouwen. Onze professionele en gepassioneerde mensen, lerende organisatie en digitale technieken ondersteunen uniforme processen en duurzame onderhoudsstrategieën.

Je komt terecht in het team Commercie & Business Development in Bunnik. Hier werk je samen met data analisten, data scientists, duurzaamheidsadviseurs, onderhoudsdeskundigen en andere specialisten, aan de toekomst van data-gedreven gebouwbeheer. Bij BAM werken we hybride, waardoor je flexibel kunt werken.

Wij bieden jou

Bij BAM investeren we in onze medewerkers en creëren we een positieve, inclusieve werkcultuur. Wij bieden jou de kans om in een innovatief en ambitieus team te werken, met voldoende ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling.

Daarnaast bieden we:



Een salaris tussen de €3.900,- en €5.400,- bruto per maand, afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring, op basis van een 40-urige werkweek (exclusief 8% vakantiegeld).
Goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden volgens de Bouw & Infra cao, inclusief 25 vakantiedagen en 15 roostervrije dagen per jaar.
Een laptop en iPhone.
Flexibiliteit in werken (hybride werken), wat zorgt voor een goede werk-privébalans.
Mogelijkheden voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling via BAM Learning en andere cursussen of trainingen.



Hier herken jij jezelf in

Wij zoeken een Data Analist die analytisch sterk is, communicatief vaardig en in staat om complexe data om te zetten in heldere inzichten.

Daarnaast heb je:



Een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding, bij voorkeur in de richting van data science, informatica, (technische)bedrijfskunde of een vergelijkbare studie.
Kennis van of ervaring met SQL, Power BI, Excel en bij voorkeur ook met Python of SkySpark.
Affiniteit met beheer & onderhoud, gebouwinstallaties en gebruikerservaring.
Affiniteit met het inrichten van datastructuren en onboardingprocessen voor nieuwe projecten.
Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en het vermogen om data-inzichten begrijpelijk over te brengen.



Het sollicitatieproces

Heeft deze uitdaging je interesse gewekt en wil je graag meer informatie? Neem dan contact op met Lamiae el Boudakhani, corporate recruiter, via telefoon, sms of WhatsApp op 06 – 50 60 18 76, of stuur een e-mail naar lamiae.el.boudakhani@bam.com. Solliciteren is eenvoudig via de sollicitatieknop op deze pagina.


Show more

Wij zoeken een Data Analist die analytisch sterk is, communicatief vaardig en in staat om complexe data om te zetten in heldere inzichten.

Daarnaast heb je:


  • Een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding, bij voorkeur in de richting van data science, informatica, (technische)bedrijfskunde of een vergelijkbare studie.
  • Kennis van of ervaring met SQL, Power BI, Excel en bij voorkeur ook met Python of SkySpark.
  • Affiniteit met beheer & onderhoud, gebouwinstallaties en gebruikerservaring.
  • Affiniteit met het inrichten van datastructuren en onboardingprocessen voor nieuwe projecten.
  • Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en het vermogen om data-inzichten begrijpelijk over te brengen.


Het sollicitatieproces

Heeft deze uitdaging je interesse gewekt en wil je graag meer informatie? Neem dan contact op met Lamiae el Boudakhani, corporate recruiter, via telefoon, sms of WhatsApp op 06 – 50 60 18 76, of stuur een e-mail naar lamiae.el.boudakhani@bam.com. Solliciteren is eenvoudig via de sollicitatieknop op deze pagina.

Title: Data & BI Analist
HTML:
Vacature: Data & BI Consultant


Bij Scope Data & AI groeit ons consulting team en daarom zijn we op zoek naar enthousiaste collega's. Als Data & BI Consultant ga je bij onze opdrachtgevers aan de slag om met data gedreven oplossingen de bedrijfsvoering te verbeteren. Dit op het snijvlak van Data Management - Data Engineering - Process mining - Business Intelligence en Reporting & Analytics.


Je speelt een cruciale rol in het analyseren, interpreteren en optimaliseren van datastromen. Deze uitdaging wordt ondersteund vanuit onze organisatie, waarvoor je werkt op basis van een vast dienstverband.


Jouw Profiel:

  • Je hebt een afgeronde HBO- of WO-studie in Informatica, Bedrijfskunde of een vergelijkbare richting;
  • Je hebt o.a. ervaring met één of meerdere BI-tools, zoals MS PowerBI, Tableau en Qliksense;
  • Ervaring met data-architectuur, data-modellering, databases, en data-integratie is een vereiste;
  • Kennis van SQL, en ervaring met MSBI (SSIS,SSRS, SSAS) zijn essentieel;
  • Je hebt expertise in datawarehousing principes (MS Azure, AWS, Google) en ETL-processen;
  • De Scrum methodiek spreekt je aan;
  • Data modellering heeft geen geheimen voor jou;
  • Uitdaging en dynamiek zijn voor jou de basis ingrediënten voor een fijne werkdag;
  • Naast een analytische denker ben je ook ondernemend en communicatief vaardig in zowel Nederlands als Engels.


Aanbod:

  • Een fantastische kans bij een groeiende organisatie met een 'wees-vooral-jezelf-mentaliteit';
  • Quality time en plezier in het werk;
  • Ontwikkeling van jouw cv met gestimuleerde ontwikkelmogelijkheden, kennisdeling, en persoonlijke begeleiding;
  • Een salaris tussen de €.3000,- en €.6000,- per maand op basis van een fulltime dienstverband;
  • Leerzame projecten bij aansprekende opdrachtgevers;
  • Goede primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden.


Reageren bij Scope Data:

Wij zijn benieuwd naar jou! Neem gerust contact met ons op om een afspraak te maken via telefoonnummer 088 - 20 549 60 of stuur een e-mail naar info@scopedata.nl.


Scope Data & AI: voor professionals en oplossingen in Data & Analytics - Consultancy, Projectmanagement, Interim Services, Werving & Selectie.

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Job Description - Data Quality Analyst

About the Role

We are looking for a Data Quality Analyst (DQA) to join a leading international financial services organization. The role is based in Amsterdam and reports directly to the Head of Data and Valuation Management.
As a DQA, you will play a critical role in ensuring the integrity, governance, and quality of data across core information systems. This position is both client-facing and internally focused, contributing to client onboarding, process improvements, and stakeholder collaboration.

Responsibilities

Own and monitor the data architecture and ensure ongoing data quality across systems.
Measure and maintain data quality standards in alignment with governance requirements.
Act as a facilitator between internal stakeholders and external market participants, including vendor management.
Contribute to both client-driven and internal projects, driving process improvements and efficiencies.
Maintain and develop the Data Governance framework and oversee the Data Dictionary.
Support client-facing activities, including onboarding new clients and handling queries from existing clients.

Requirements

Must-Have Skills & Experience:

2+ years' experience in data structuring, data models, and governance frameworks.
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Finance, Economics, or Business Administration.
Strong technical skills in Excel; knowledge of Visual Basic and SQL is an advantage.
Strong organizational skills with the ability to work independently.
Excellent stakeholder management skills, with the ability to build relationships locally and internationally.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Fluency in Dutch and English (both written and spoken).
Nice-to-Have Skills:
Knowledge of investment strategies, reporting systems, and investment procedures.
Experience with SimCorp Dimension or Bloomberg.
Understanding of performance and risk analysis methodologies.
French language skills (advantageous).

Contract & Benefits

Contract type: Permanent

Hours: 40 hours per week (full-time)

Location: Amsterdam

Additional benefits:

Participation in discretionary performance bonus
Full employer contribution to pension
Net home working allowance + internet allowance
28 + 1 holiday days, with option to buy additional hours
International working environment with strong collaboration culture
Modern office in central Amsterdam with supportive colleagues

Hiring Process & Timeline

Two-stage interview process.
Interviews expected to begin in early September (hiring manager returns 3rd September).
Target start date: October-November 2025 (flexible).




Desired Skills and Experience

Data Quality

Data Governance

Data Modeling

Data Architecture

Data Management

Data Analysis

Data Dictionary

SQL

Excel

Visual Basic (VBA)

SimCorp Dimension (if applicable)

Bloomberg Terminal (if applicable)

Reporting & Analytics



Venquis is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.
